Use grub-reboot or just hold shift at boot to see the menu

Then grub-reboot is what you want
It will change the default for exactly one boot

The actual entries are in /boot/grub/grub.cfg
no they are not
What do you mean? Can you pastebin your /boot/grub/grub.cfg because it should definitely have menu entries
If you want to just list all of the entries you can do: sudo grep menuentry /boot/grub/grub.cfg | grep -o '".*"'

Your changes will be overwritten by update-grub ( just like they would with grub legacy )
Why do you want to comment entries out?

Which entries? If it's old kernels then remove them, if it's memtest remove /etc/grub.d/20_memtest86+

Yes, then run "sudo update-grub"
